name: Goldfish-in-a-bowl

specials.name: Goldfish dance
specials.description: The Goldfish-in-a-bowl erupts in a wonderful and complex dance. Every creature in a 30 foot radius must make a Will save against its Performance DC or become fascinated. A creature stays fascinated this way as long as the Goldfish-in-a-bowl spends one action each turn to keep dancing, without further saving throws.

specials.name: Reel in
specials.description: Requirements A Fascinated creature is within 30 feet of the Goldfish-in-a-bowl Effect The Goldfish-in-a-bowl produces an effect similar to the spell command, but using its Performance DC for the will save, and the only action it can command is to approach.

specials.name: Swift bite
specials.description: equirements A creature is adjacent to the Goldfish-in-a-bowl Effect The Goldfish-in-a-bowl suddendly springs forward. Make a bite attack. If the attack is successful, make a grapple check.

specials.name: Blood frenzy
specials.description: Requirements The Goldfish-in-a-bowl has grabbed another creature Effect The Goldfish-in-a-bowl viciously feeds on its victim, dealing 1d6 piercing damage and 1 persistent bleed damage.

description:
What would appear as an unassuming yet lively goldfish in a transparent glass bowl is in fact a devious and cunning creature that feeds on those who falls for its ruse. The glass bowl itself is in fact a part of its body, and it's soft and warm to the touch, but usually is too late for anyone that notices this fact. The "goldfish" inside is actually the head of the creature, and it can spring forward to bite its prey with a very large mouth filled with razor sharp teeth, much like a piranha.
When it's digesting a prey the "water" inside the bowl turns a murky red, as bits and pieces of the last meal it's had can bee seen swirling around. After about a day the digestion process is complete, and its body become crystal clear once again.
Rumors say that unscrupulous wizards create them only to be sold as exotic "pets", changing the appearance of the bowl and the fish inside every time so that those who are aware of the existance of this creature can never be sure of what they're seeing before is too late.
Given its peculiar appearence, it uses its cunning to exploit a simpleton in doing its bidding, making the person in question carrying them around so that it feed off its unsuspecting preys.
It can also be found at some questionable sideshows, where is exploited by ruthless conmen advertising their collection of incredible animals to easily collect valuables off the dead.
They can seldom be found in the wilds, where this disguise is not very effective, and thus have the tendency to avoid rural settings.
